NAME: Chernobyl Disaster
DESCRIPTION: The April 1986 disaster at the Chernobyl nuclear power plant in Ukraine was the product of a flawed Soviet reactor design coupled with serious mistakes made by the plant operators. It was a direct consequence of Cold War isolation and the resulting lack of any safety culture.

NAME: Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Disaster
DESCRIPTION: The Fukushima Daiichi nuclear event was an accident at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant, triggered by a tsunami causing equipment and power failures.
